item.title: Psychedelic Ayahuasca Moves into the Mainstream
item.description:
Psychedelic Ayahuasca Moves into the Mainstream

I grew up with Matt. We went to grade school and high school together - we've been friends for some 27 years. He was always ahead of the curve on drugs. When we were in seventh grade we went to the Eagles' Hell Freezes Over tour: Matt was happily hitting up people our parents' age for tokes as I innocently buried my nose beneath my sweatshirt.

item.title: Ayahuasca Shipibo Icaros - Shaman Songs from the Amazon Rainforest
item.description:
Ayahuasca Shipibo Icaros - Shaman Songs from the Amazon Rainforest

Listen to Matilda and Cecilia sing the traditional Ayahuasca icaros (songs) that are embedded in their handwoven tapestries. Filmed at the Paititi Institute in Iquitos, Peru. For more stories and photos from the Amazon, check out http://greggoodman.me/1m30bWD

item.title: Shipibo-Konibo Quene Designs
item.description:
Shipibo-Konibo Quene Designs

Written, produced, edited and narrated by Keith Rozendal

item.title: A Visionary Animated Film | Song of the Amazon
item.description:
A Visionary Animated Film | Song of the Amazon

Song of the Amazon is a visionary feature-length animated film created to share the stories and cosmology of the Shipibo-Konibo indigenous people of the Peruvian Amazon. This groundbreaking film brings Shipibo visual music and stories of the Amazon to life in a way that has never before been seen outside of the experiential visions of the plant medicine, Ayahuasca.

item.title: Shipibo ayahuasca embroidery art and textiles - Iquitos, Peru - Teolinda and Amelia Rengifo Sanchez
item.description:
Shipibo ayahuasca embroidery art and textiles - Iquitos, Peru - Teolinda and Amelia Rengifo Sanchez

The Shipibo are noted for a rich and complex cosmology, which is tied directly to the art and artifacts they produce. Do√±a Teolinda and Amelia Rengifo Sanchez are sisters. Their livelihood depends on the appreciation that tourists have of their ancestral art form.

item.title: Terence McKenna - Alien Dreamtime (Live) [HQ]
item.description:
Terence McKenna - Alien Dreamtime (Live) [HQ]

History is Ending... Terence McKenna's epic live recording. This is a must see/hear!

item.title: Shocking statement made by two renowned scientists: death does not exist
item.description:
Shocking statement made by two renowned scientists: death does not exist

What happens after we die? Is death the end of everything or is there any life after death? I think many of us have been curious about this at least once in our lifetime. Two researchers specialized in quantum physics state that they can prove the existence of life after death and the soul.

item.title: Merrilee Challiss' psychedelic visions are mind-bendingly cool
item.description:
Merrilee Challiss' psychedelic visions are mind-bendingly cool

Merrilee Challiss has had a hell of a year. The Alabama-based artist got a divorce, and soon after she closed the business she'd owned for nine years - Birmingham cafe and music venue The Bottletree. "I had to sell my business or go bankrupt," Challiss tells the Scene.

item.title: Shaman Explains How Ayahuasca Can Facilitate A Spiritual Awakening
item.description:
Shaman Explains How Ayahuasca Can Facilitate A Spiritual Awakening

Ayahuasca has been used in religious ceremonies for centuries. Called the "vine of the soul," ayahuasca is a brew typically made from the Banisteriopsis caapi vine and Psychotria viridis leavesthat grow predominantly in Brazil, Peru and other regions of South America.

item.title: No title
item.description: The latest Tweets from AyaMountainKY (@AyaMountainKY). Ayahuasca retreat in America. We are a Native American Church helping others on their #Ayahuasca spiritual journeys. Berea, KY
